steps.description: Fmoc-rink amide AM resin was weighed out, and the beads were allowed to swell for 1h in DMF.
Fmoc deprotection was achieved with a mixture of 20% v/v piperidine in DMF, which was added to the resin and left to agitate for 15 min.

After thorough washing with DMF, 2 equiv. of HOBt and HBTU were dissolved in DMF and combined. Another 2 equiv. of the initial protected amino acid, pre-dissolved in DMF, were introduced to the mixture, followed by the addition of 2 equiv. of DIPEA to the same solution, allowing 20 seconds for activation.

Subsequently, this solution was added to the resin and left to agitate for 45 minutes. The resin was washed with DMF and subjected to a series of deprotection and coupling reactions with the desired amino acids. All the reactions were performed at 25°C, and the couplings were monitored via Kaiser test.
After a though washing with DMF, a DMF solution of 12 equiv. of Ac2O and DIPEA was added (capping) to prevent side reactions of the side-groups, and the mixture was incubated for 30 minutes.
To obtain the P1, the Fmoc group of the final amino acid was deprotected.
Then, the N-terminus of P1 was acetylated using a 5-times excess of Ac2O and DIPEA.
The resin was subsequently washed with DMF and DCM and allowed to dry before the peptide cleavage step using a mixture of 94% TFA, 3% Milli-Q water and 3% TIS.
The solvents were reduced under an argon atmosphere, and Et2O was added to precipitate the peptide.
The peptides were isolated through several centrifugations, washed with Et2O, and dried under reduced pressure.

The peptides were then lyophilized in Milli-Q water with the presence of 0.01% TFA and analyzed by high-performance liquid chromatography system coupled to a mass spectrometer (HPLC-MS, Thermo scientific, Ultimate 3000 HPLC system coupled with maXis UHR-TOF).

equipment.name: HPLC-MS
equipment.settings: Ultimate 3000 HPLC system coupled with maXis UHR-TOF

equipment.name: HPLC-MS
equipment.settings: Ultimate 3000 HPLC system coupled with maXis UHR-TOF

equipment.name: Brucker maXis UHR-TOF
equipment.settings: ESI electrospray ionization chamber in positive mode

synthesis.notes: The purity of the desired peptides ranged between 95 and 99%, therefore, no further purification was necessary. Yield: 287 mg (57.4%).

evaluation.reasoning: The extraction captures the synthesis of Ac-LIVKHH-NH2 (P1) using Fmoc/Boc solid-phase peptide chemistry. The structural completeness is good, covering most materials, steps, and conditions. Material extraction is generally accurate, with correct names and units, although some quantities are missing. Process steps are well-organized and sequenced. Equipment extraction is adequate, but could benefit from more specific settings. Conditions extraction is reasonable, but lacks some details. Semantic accuracy is maintained, and the format generally complies with the schema. Overall, the extraction is of good quality, but some improvements can be made to enhance completeness and accuracy.

scores.structural_completeness_reasoning: The extraction covers most of the key aspects of the synthesis, including materials, steps, equipment, and conditions. However, some minor details are missing, such as specific quantities for all materials and detailed equipment settings.
scores.material_extraction_reasoning: Material names and units are generally accurate. However, some quantities are missing (e.g., for DIPEA and DMF). The vendor information is mostly correct. Purity is sometimes not specified when available in the text.
scores.process_steps_reasoning: The process steps are well-organized and logically sequenced, accurately reflecting the synthesis procedure. The actions are correctly classified.
scores.equipment_extraction_reasoning: The equipment is identified, but the extraction could benefit from more specific settings for instruments like the lyophilizer and HPLC-MS. Vendor information is provided for some equipment.
scores.conditions_extraction_reasoning: The extraction captures some key conditions like temperature and duration, but lacks details on atmosphere for some steps and stirring conditions. pH adjustments are mentioned but not quantified in all relevant steps.
scores.semantic_accuracy_reasoning: The extraction accurately preserves the scientific meaning of the synthesis procedure. The relationships between materials, steps, and conditions are correctly represented.
scores.format_compliance_reasoning: The extraction generally adheres to the GeneralSynthesisOntology schema and data type requirements. Some minor inconsistencies may exist, but overall, the format is compliant.
scores.overall_reasoning: The extraction is of good quality, accurately capturing the synthesis of Ac-LIVKHH-NH2. While the structure, materials, and steps are well-represented, improvements can be made in equipment settings, condition details, and completeness of material quantities.

Detailed settings for the lyophilizer and HPLC-MS.

Ensure consistency in the representation of units and quantities.

steps.description: Pre-weighed peptide powder of P1 and P2 was dissolved in total volume of 1 or 2 mL (depending on the measurement) in Milli-Q water
0.5 equiv. of Zn(OAc)2 was added to the solution.
The vial was vortexed and sonicated for 10-20 sec to achieve a homogenous solution.
The pH was then adjusted to approximately 7 using 750 mM NaOH solution.
The vials were kept on the bench, and hydrogel formation was initially observed over time via the vial inversion method and later was verified through rheology.

synthesis.notes: Similar hydrogels were prepared also in absence of Zn(OAc)2. Similar hydrogels were prepared using 10% buffer in Milli-Q water and then added 0.5 equiv. of Zn(OAc)2. The glass vial, where hydrogels prepared, was vortexed for 10-20 sec to achieve an even distribution of the buffer.

evaluation.reasoning: The extracted ontology captures the synthesis of metallo-hydrogels reasonably well, but there are areas for improvement. The material extraction is mostly accurate, although the exact amounts of peptides are missing. The process steps are logically sequenced and generally accurate, but lack specific durations for some actions. Equipment extraction is minimal. Conditions extraction is adequate but could be more precise. Semantic accuracy is generally maintained, and the format compliance is good. Overall, the extraction provides a solid foundation but needs more detail to be truly comprehensive.
